eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Gamepads
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, trigger pressure, etc...
description: Add support for gamepads (or other controllers) to your game, giving access to information such as button presses, axis positions, axis force, trigger pressure, deadzone for each gamepad, etc...
Up to 4 gamepads can be connected. For each condition or expression, you'll have to enter the index of the gamepad to read. This is 1, 2, 3 or 4.

eventsFunctions.description: Get the value of the pressure on a gamepad trigger.
eventsFunctions.name: TriggerPressure
eventsFunctions.sentence: Player _PARAM1_ push axis _PARAM2_ to _PARAM3_

inlineCode: console.error('Parameter gamepad identifier in expression: "Pressure on a gamepad trigger", is not valid number, must be between 0 and 4.');

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the force value of a gamepad stick.
0 is stick on default position, 1 is at the maximum.
eventsFunctions.name: StickForce
eventsFunctions.sentence: Player _PARAM1_ push axis _PARAM2_ to _PARAM3_

inlineCode: console.error('Parameter gamepad identifier is not valid in expression: "Value of a stick force"');
console.error('Parameter stick is not valid in expression: "Value of a stick force"');
//we need keep this condition because when use have not yet plug her controller we can't get the controller in the gamepad variable.

eventsFunctions.description:
Get the rotation value of a gamepad stick.
If the deadzone value is high, the angle value is rounded to main axes, left, left, up, down.
An zero deadzone value give a total freedom on the angle value.
eventsFunctions.name: StickRotationValue
eventsFunctions.sentence: Player _PARAM1_ push axis _PARAM2_ to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description:
Test if a button is released on a gamepad. Buttons can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Other: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT".

eventsFunctions.description:
Return the last button pressed. 
Buttons for Xbox and PS4 can be:
* Xbox: "A", "B", "X", "Y", "LB", "RB", "LT", "RT", "BACK", "START",
* PS4: "CROSS", "SQUARE", "CIRCLE", "TRIANGLE", "L1", "L2", "R1", "R2", "SHARE", "OPTIONS", "PS_BUTTON", "CLICK_TOUCHPAD",
* Both: "UP", "DOWN", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "CLICK_STICK_LEFT", "CLICK_STICK_RIGHT".

eventsFunctions.name: Deadzone

eventsFunctions.description: Set the deadzone for sticks of the gamepad. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved). Deadzone is between 0 and 1, and is by default 0.2.
eventsFunctions.name: A_Set_deadzone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set deadzone for sticks on gamepad: _PARAM1_ to _PARAM2_

inlineCode: console.error('Parameter gamepad identifier in action: "Set gamepad deadzone for sticks", is not valid, must be between 0 and 4.');

parameters.description: Deadzone for sticks, 0.2 by default (0 to 1)
parameters.name: deadzone

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: RectangleMovement
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern with easing functions from the Tween extension.
An example allows to check some settings ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://rectangular-movement)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Move objects in a rectangular pattern.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: RectangleMovement

events.comment: Set the initial state according to the configuration.
Update the rectangle when the object is moved outside of the behavior.
Move the object on the rectangular path.
Save the position to detect when the object is moved outside of the behavior.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DrawShockWaveEffect
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Draw a shock wave animation that looks like an explosion and other visual effects.
description: Draw a shock wave animation that looks like an explosion and other visual effects.
Shock wave shape can be a circle or star pattern.
- Assign behavior to a shape-painter object
- Create the shape-painter object where you want the shock wave to appear
- Shock wave animation will start automatically
- Shape-painter will delete itself after the animation is finished
- Appearance of the shock wave can be changed by editing the behavior properties
- Properties can be edited in the scene editor or by using actions after the shape-painter object is created
